By executing this query, in any manner whatsoever, you agree to abide by these terms.  In some limited cases, domains that might appear as available in whois might not actually be available as they could be already registered and the whois not yet updated and/or they could be part of the Restricted list. In this cases, performing a check through your Registrar's (EPP check) will give you the actual status of the domain. Additionally, domains currently or previously used as extensions in 3rd level domains will not be available for registration in the 2nd level. thought: The WHOIS information indicates that the domain is not currently registered, which is suspicious for a legitimate business. Additionally, the registrant's contact information is redacted for privacy, which is not unusual, but in the context of other red flags, could be cause for concern. The domain also has a status of pendingDelete, which means it is in the process of being deleted. This is not typical for an operational, legitimate website. Given that the domain is pending deletion and the website content suggests a domain suspension that has been restored, this could be an attempt to quickly set up a scam site before the domain is deleted. I should now check for any customer feedback or online mentions to confirm suspicions.
observation: [{'url': 'https://thisisnovos.com/blog/10-ways-to-implement-a-successful-blog-on-magento-2/', 'content': "By default, Magento 2 doesn't have a blog. observation.reason: The website's domain is pending deletion which is atypical for an operational business. The WHOIS information indicates that the domain is not currently registered and the registrant's contact information is redacted. The lack of online presence or customer feedback combined with the website's content suggesting a previous domain suspension are indicative of a potential scam.
